elements.text:
TO COMPLETE YOUR REGISTRATION, YOU MUST AGREE TO LEIGH DAY'S PAPERWORK. YOU CAN DO THIS BY PRESSING 'I ACCEPT' AT THE BOTTOM OF THE PAGE.

If all of your information is correct, Leigh Day solicitors are willing to represent you in your equal pay claim against Co-op on a no-win no-fee basis, subject to regulatory checks.

If you want Leigh Day to bring a claim for you, you need to click the accept button at the bottom of this page. This confirms you have read and agree to the client care and costs letter, form of authority, and the Damages-Based Agreement (‘DBA’) below. You also agree that this agreement is of your own free will.

Leigh Day can terminate the DBA at any time at no cost to you. You have the right to cancel your agreement within 14 days, but after this point if you terminate the DBA before the end of the claim or act unreasonably (please see sections 7 and 10 of the DBA), you may be required to pay Leigh Day your share of costs as they are at that time.

The button to agree to these documents can be found at the bottom of the page.

### Funding Agreement (DBA) Summary

Leigh Day realise that the sign-up documents are lengthy and contain legal jargon that they are required to provide to you by law.  They have therefore set out below a summary of the main terms found within these documents.

### Legal funding

- You are signing a “no-win, no-fee” agreement. If Leigh Day don’t win compensation for you, and you keep to the terms of the agreement, you won’t be charged a penny.

- If you do win, Leigh Day will deduct a fee equivalent to 25% (plus VAT) of any compensation obtained. The current VAT rate is 20%, which means that the total of amount of compensation payable to Leigh Day would be 30%.

- In the end, no matter what, you will get 70% of your compensation (so for every £100 that you win, you will keep £70, minus any deductions for tax and National Insurance). Leigh Day think that’s fair as they are taking a risk taking the case on a “no-win, no-fee” basis and we hope that you feel this is fair too.

- This means that either way the case is decided, you will not be left out of pocket. Leigh Day will never ask you to pay any fees upfront or throughout the life of the claim.

### Co-operating with Leigh Day

- As part of the agreement, Leigh Day require you to keep in touch with Leigh Day and to behave reasonably. If you fail to cooperate with Leigh Day, e.g. by not providing Leigh Day with your up-to-date contact details or ignoring calls, emails or letters, then Leigh Day will no longer be able to act for you and will treat you as ending the agreement. Therefore, please only sign up if you are willing to cooperate. Please refer to the funding documents for Leigh Day's rights if you fail to co-operate.

- To be eligible as a client, you need to be an hourly-paid store worker or have left your employment within the last six months. This is due to the strict time limits in place for submitting a claim to the Employment Tribunal once your employment has ended.

### Changing your mind

- You have 14 days from signing up to change your mind about proceeding with the action and simply need to inform Leigh Day in writing that you no longer wish to proceed with the claim.

Please note, reading this summary is not a substitute for reading the funding documents themselves.

{{document.URL.includes('maddisonclarke.co.uk') ? `[Read full Client Care and Costs Letter and Damaged Based Agreement](https://maddisonclarke.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/COOP_DBA.pdf)` : `[Read full Client Care and Costs Letter and Damaged Based Agreement](https://www.fairpayforall.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/CO-OP_DBA.pdf)` }}

By clicking the 'I accept' button below you will have joined the Co-op equal pay claim. If your claim is successful, you agree to pay Leigh Day a fee equivalent to 25% plus VAT of any compensation received from Co-op.

You have the right to cancel your agreement with Leigh Day within 14 days of entering it.

Leigh Day's Privacy Policy can be found [here](https://www.leighday.co.uk/our-privacy-and-cookies-policy/).

## Thank you for completing the form to join the Co-op Equal Pay Claim. Please keep an eye out for an email from us.

If you haven’t received a confirmation email within 48 hours, please contact Leigh Day’s Co-op Equal Pay Claims team at [coopequalpay@leighday.co.uk](mailto:coopequalpay@leighday.co.uk).
